full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 755 Filed 08/10/22 Page 106 of 262 1811
LC8VMAX4
1 Q. Other than on one of Mr. Epstein's planes, how else would you interact with Ms. Maxwell between 1994 and 2004?
2 A. Early on it would be by beeper, if she needed something; and then later on we had cell phones. And, you know, occasionally I would see her at the office, and obviously on the airplane.
3 Q. Other than on the airplane and at the office, did you ever see Ms. Maxwell anywhere else in person?
4 A. Yes, I would see her at her house.
5 Q. Why would you go to her house?
6 A. She had first aid kits that we also had maintained on our airplane; and so we provided her with those first aid kits. And so they had to be refurbished once a year. So I would go there to pick it up, and then return it after it got refurbished.
7 Q. Between 1991, when you first met her, and 2004, what residences of Ms. Maxwell's did you personally visit?
8 A. The first one would have been on 59th Street near Columbus Circle. The second one would have been a studio apartment, not sure of the location, probably Upper East Side of Manhattan. And then she had an apartment, large apartment, on 84th Street. And then she had a townhouse on 65th Street.
9 Q. I want to walk through each of those, please. When did you go to the 59th Street apartment?
10 A. In the fall of 1991. I don't recall exactly when.
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00018968

1 Q. Other than on one of Mr. Epstein's planes, how else would you interact with Ms. Maxwell between 1994 and 2004?
2 A. Early on it would be by beeper, if she needed something; and then later on we had cell phones. And, you know, occasionally I would see her at the office, and obviously on the airplane.
3 Q. Other than on the airplane and at the office, did you ever see Ms. Maxwell anywhere else in person?
4 A. Yes, I would see her at her house.
5 Q. Why would you go to her house?
6 A. She had first aid kits that we also had maintained on our airplane; and so we provided her with those first aid kits. And so they had to be refurbished once a year. So I would go there to pick it up, and then return it after it got refurbished.
7 Q. Between 1991, when you first met her, and 2004, what residences of Ms. Maxwell's did you personally visit?
8 A. The first one would have been on 59th Street near Columbus Circle. The second one would have been a studio apartment, not sure of the location, probably Upper East Side of Manhattan. And then she had an apartment, large apartment, on 84th Street. And then she had a townhouse on 65th Street.
9 Q. I want to walk through each of those, please. When did you go to the 59th Street apartment?
10 A. In the fall of 1991. I don't recall exactly when.
